Pre-Game Insights: Germany enters this knockout stage with a renewed sense of confidence, having banished the demons of their last two World Cup campaigns, which ended in premature group-stage exits.
Julian Nagelsmann’s men topped Group A, securing their place in the last 16 with dominant performances, including a 7-0 aggregate scoreline against Scotland and Hungary.
Germany has shown their attacking depth, scoring goals from various positions and maintaining defensive discipline.
Denmark’s journey to the knockout stages was less straightforward. The Scandinavian side finished second in Group C, a group notorious for its low-scoring matches.
Denmark has built a reputation for being a tough team to break down. Despite their low goal tally in the group stages, their defensive solidity has been commendable.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match holds significant importance as both teams strive to secure a spot in the quarter-finals, where a potential clash with either Spain or Georgia awaits.
Germany’s current form has been impressive, with notable victories and strong performances in their group matches.
Denmark, while not as prolific in front of goal, has proven difficult to beat, with their organized defense and strategic gameplay.
Others: The match is set to take place at the iconic Signal Iduna Park in Dortmund on June 29, 2024, at 8pm UK time.
Both teams have shown their resilience in 2024, with Germany winning five and drawing two of their seven matches, and Denmark also sharing an unbeaten run with Germany.
The suspension of Jonathan Tah and Rudiger’s hamstring issue could pose challenges for Germany, potentially disrupting their defensive setup.
The suspension of Morten Hjulmand, combined with Jonas Wind’s recent struggles up front, means Hjulmand may need to shuffle his lineup to find the right balance for Denmark.
